headline.main: German Police Arrest Associate Of Hijacker Cell

lead_paragraph: German police have arrested a Moroccan man who they say had intense contacts with Mohamed Atta and other Sept. 11 suicide hijackers, managing one of their bank accounts and moving money to several of the men while they underwent flight training in the United States a year before the attacks. It was the first time the German authorities had arrested anyone they said was linked to the group of Muslim militants believed to have planned the hijackings from the German port of Hamburg.
abstract: German police arrest Mounir el-Motassadeq, Moroccan; say he had intense contacts with Mohamed Atta and other Sept 11 hijackers, managed bank account belonging to hijacker Marwan al-Shehhi and moved money to several of men while they underwent flight training in United States last year; Belgian police report detaining Algerian charged with falsifying Belgian passports used by men who killed Ahmed Shah Massoud, Afghan Northern Alliance leader, before hijackings; photo (M)
